abstracts.cdata!:
Financial closing for the 60-megawatt,
            diesel-powered power station project occurred on October 14,
            1994, setting several milestones for Jamaica and the Bank:
            It is the largest private infrastructure project in Jamaica
            to date; it is the first build-own-operate project in
            Jamaica; it is the first Bank-supported build-own-operate
            project to reach financial closure; it is the first project
            jointly supported by the Bank and MIGA; and it is the first
            Bank loan to facilitate access to low-cost construction
            financing provided by commercial lenders. This Note
            discusses the project, the financing plan, and the role of
            the World Bank Group.
